title: 18-year-old suspect in Kettering student shooting identified
content:
KETTERING, Ohio (WDTN) – Kettering Police have confirmed 18-year-old Miles Heizer one of the four teenagers detained in connection to a shooting Sunday night.
The victim Ronnie Bowers, 16, has died Tuesday night, according to an investigator with the Montgomery County Coroner’s Office.
It happened just after 9:30 p.m. Sunday on Willowdale Avenue near Ackerman Boulevard. The shooting took place several blocks away from a crowded AlterFest at Archbishop Alter High School.
Police said a group of teens got into a dispute at AlterFest. Officers said one group left, but the other group followed to Willowdale Avenue and Ackerman Boulevard when a fight broke out.
“The victim was trying to leave the area was starting to drive away was shot once in the back of the head,” said Kettering Police Chief Christopher Protsman.
Kettering Police also confirmed that a Kettering-Fairmont student was shot and rushed to the hospital.
Police said they detained four teens on felonious assault charges including two, 16-year-olds, an 18-year-old Heizer and a 15-year-old. The teens are all students at Kettering-Fairmont High School.
